thread.title: Oscar Overseer PricewaterhouseCoopers Apologizes for Award Mixup - WSJ
thread.title_full: Oscar Overseer PricewaterhouseCoopers Apologizes for Award Mixup - WSJ

author: Michael Rapoport
title: Oscar Overseer PricewaterhouseCoopers Apologizes for Award Mixup - WSJ
text:
Oscar Overseer PricewaterhouseCoopers Apologizes for Award Mixup Accounting firm takes responsibility for mistake that led to wrong film announced as Best Picture winner In a dramatic turn of events, “Moonlight” won best picture at the 2017 Oscars after the award was initially given to favorite “La La Land.” The romantic musical, this year’s expected big winner, won six out of 14 nominations. Photo: Reuters By michael.rapoport.7 Feb. 27, 2017 3:55 a.m. ET 
Accounting firm PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP took responsibility and apologized early Monday for the error that led to the mistaken announcement of “La La Land” as Best Picture at the Academy Awards instead of the actual winner, “Moonlight.” 
PwC, the longtime overseer of the Oscar voting process, said Best Picture presenters Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway had mistakenly been given the envelope for the wrong category. PwC has two duplicate sets of envelopes at the ceremony with the winners’ names, and the presenters were... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
